description: Albania enforced a curfew from 6PM - 6AM starting on March 17th.
Albania changed curfew restrictions on all residents which limited trips outside the home to 6-10AM and 4-6PM.
Albania changed the curfew hours so that residents could only go outside from 5AM to 1PM.
Albania further restricted movement of residents. Only one member per household could leave each day for one hour. Residents need to apply for a permit to leave their homes for essential purposes.
Albania is enforcing a complete lockdown from 1PM on Saturday April 4th until 5AM on Monday April 6th.
Albania is extending the number of hours that grocery stores and pharmacies are open from 5AM to 1PM to 5AM to 5PM starting on Monday April 13th.
Albania is changing the hours of the weekend lockdown to Fridays at 17:30 until Mondays at 5AM.
Albania extended weekend quarantine hours. Weekend quarantine hours will now be from Fridays at 5:30PM until Mondays at 5AM.

Albania is relaxing lockdown restrictions in low risk towns of Diber and Gjirokaster along with the municipalities of Pogradec, Prrenjas, Librazhd, Saranda, Himara, Konispol, Finiq, and Divjak starting on April 27th. Residents can move on foot and by car from 9:30AM until 5:30PM without authorization.
Albania will relax the restrictions on shopping on April 27th and extends the allowed time for essential errands to 2 hours.
Albania loosened restrictions on April 27th and gave residents 90 minutes a day for shopping and essential chores.

Albania is continuing a weekend lockdown from Fridays at 5:30PM until Mondays at 5AM. Senior citizens will be allowed to go outside for a walk on Saturdays and Sundays until 10AM. Mothers with children under 14 years old can go outside on Saturdays and Sundays from 11:30AM until 5:30PM.
Albania is relaxing curfew restrictions in red zone cities starting on May 18th. All residents can travel freely from 5AM until 9PM.
Albania is removing curfew restrictions in all parts of Albania starting on June 1st.
Albania declared a state of emergency on March 25th.
Albania will extend the state of emergency until June 23rd.
Albania banned all flights and ferries between Albania and Italy for one month beginning on March 8th.
